BKbBwmBkff9vEEGcnSKXgA.text: Love this place! I go here at least once a week and have tried about six things on their menu. The food is always fresh and you get large portions. I would compare it positively to any other Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh. The atmosphere is very casual, nothing fancy. But staff are super nice and the food comes out very quickly. The 1 to 10 rating scale means something here. I get an eight, and it's always quite spicy. Great red curry, pad prik khing, and garlic pepper. You won't go wrong eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

9cjOJEyyip97suNhDRXdyQ.text: I've only been here once but the spring roll and drunken noodles were excellent.  They have hot oil and thai hot pepper flakes on the table to add yourself and the oil is delicious.  Prices are cheap, and the menu is filled with your standard Thai options.  I plan on working my way thru the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunken Noodles
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IrVhOZyl1EiwKB8y506CvA.text: Food was horrible. We ordered tofu pad Thai & chicken pad Thai via Grubhub app, these are not complex dishes to prepare & are standard on Thai restaurant menus. The food took over 1 hour to arrive to our hotel which is approximately 2 miles away from the restaurant. When the driver arrived at our hotel he called us via cellphone & asked us to come outside in the rain to get it from him. After some coaxing he agreed to bring it to our room. When the food arrived, it was cold, bland, & unseasoned. Very disappointing for the price & time wait. We will not be ordering from this restaurant again, & nor should you.

3KIodBbA48ICGEa6QphRFA.text: They can never get a take out order correct. I called ahead of time on MANY occasions for food. The food wasn't cooking yet, or was not done.   I've had to wait a long time for my food  on MANY occasions. I always order in advance and they almost NEVER get it right. Don't waste your precious time to go here for lunch. You can't depend on them. They have Bad customer service as you can see, as well as overall CONSISTENCY issues with the service and the food. Read the other reviews with the same issuess. It's Not worth it. Avoid the headache. The quality of food versus service is not worth it at all whatsoever.

5YZegbSJ9EiXu7BAK3jg7A.text: The only thing I have tried here is the Thai Fried Rice. It is delicious. In my opinion this fried rice is better than that of the other Thai spot downtown, Nicky's.

lmAixu48zepBOYbCO27TPA.text: Lunch service was fast and accurate.  I asked for an 8 spice level and that's exactly what I got,  which is refreshing.  Rive was a tad overcooked but the cashew tofu was perfect.  The vegetables weren't overcooked and they did not skimp!  Will be back weekly at this point.

LKXN15IvnGpe_cHp3Bntlw.text: I had the pad thai, usually my favorite thai dish, also tried the red curry. Pad thai was Ok, noodles seemed a little soggy, barely any vegetables in the dish. The dining area seem bleak. Service was average friendly. Not something I would race over town to eat. If it's the only thing around - ok.

7YkmRU3GJRBLfOzCvOchJQ.text: Love this place. Best drunken noodles in Pittsburgh. When they do the Rangoon for the starter and not the soup, it is my favorite lunch downtown. Their pad Thai is great also. Definitely not a fine dining spot but the food is great.

GMtuEew_lozZvr6yB2OrRg.text: Walked in and was not greeted. Sat for 15 minutes unacknowledged. Left without a word said to me.

icEsr0E_QS3eunJFYJ9Ckg.text: Siam is probably the best Thai food in Pittsburgh!!!  Definitely the best downtown!!  The service there is unbeatable!!  The staff is so friendly.  They are very accommodating and never rush you through your meal.   The produce is fresh and the ingredients are above par!  The prices are good and you get a LOT for what you pay.  Get the Pad Thai or Pad See Ew, great thai iced tea and coffee.  The atmosphere is great - music is cool and decor is very nice.  I would definitely take a group, or have an intimate dinner as well.  Overall, very impressed.  10/10!!

IxOBlTq1rankAuUfDP5QyA.text: Came across this place when leaving my dentist's office across the street.  Needed to grab take-out to bring back to work with me, so I decided to give them a try. Ordered Thai spring rolls and vegetable pad thai.  Waited about 20 minutes for my order. Everything was steaming hot, which was great. However: Though the spring rolls were nicely hot and crunchy, they had no flavor/seasoning other then a black pepper taste. They seemed to be primarily cabbage - I didn't see any other vegetables in them.    The pad thai was not good. The noodles were overcooked, rubbery and dark - not fresh.  I have come across this issue with take-out from other thai restaurants. I wonder if, for take-out, some places have a bunch of pre-made items that they just reheat in the microwave? I don't know how else to explain these rubbery, shriveled noodles. Plus, the sauce had a strange taste - maybe like it was a beef-base? Very odd. And disappointing, especially considering the pretty positive "Munch" article they had framed on their wall that featured both items I had ordered.  Since I'm pregnant, I didn't eat more than a few bites of the pad thai because it just didn't taste right to me.  Not planning to go out of my way to go back there.

A4mtHu4kD-ksTXUrcjsRsA.text: This place is my total new favorite! The service was fast. Dining room clean and simple, but not fancy (just what I like for in between class nosh), and the food was excellent! Be warned, though,  I think their food is just a little spicer than what's usually in the burgh, so dial down the first time you're in.  But it was so good!

IrU3A2UUMXo4K8W5wYq2LQ.text: They seem to be mind readers because the food comes extremely fast and the prices are great. Samosas are yummy, soup is a nice spicy broth with tofu and mushrooms and the pad see ew and pad kee mow are your standard noodle dishes. If you like spicy I would probably go with a 9 or 10. I got an 8 and definitely could have handled more spice.

bPWAuc0wvszlvPN1gwpSfw.text: Great food, service and affordable prices. I've had Pad See Eww, Drunken Noodles and Fried rice. Never need disappointed. Service is fast so they are ideal for lunch. They are tucked away downtown so if you like to get off the beaten path its perfect. $8 minimum for credit cards but that's no problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai spicy fried rice....level 5 on a scale from 1-10.
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried wonton...free while you wait for your food.  Yay!

6cMrHHH5Xwnv2VYRnVYm2Q.text: Very unassuming spot with great food! I had driven by, but never stopped in until today. Hmmm...good food. Nice atmosphere. Great for a quick business lunch. Big Plus:  Nice portions. We had no leftovers. It was a nice lunch size portion.  They start with a small little appetizer. The menu is small, but has a nice variety. The food came out very quickly. Definitely a place you could go with 1/2 hour.   I had 3.5 spice on the green curry; trying to keep it light during work hours. It had quite the kick so be cautious around your spice scale when ordering. All-in-all, a nice lunch experience. I would definitely go back.

mrJHbILCIMsDd-aXqcX06Q.text: Honestly, I was a little bit disappointed.  I ordered the Pad Thai and it was incredibly dry and sort of bland flavor-wise. On top of that, my mango juice tasted like onion which was pretty odd. Overall, you get a good amount of food for what you're paying, but the quality really isn't the best. Average dinner for me and my taste buds.

Z4WVBEleZpzh4UMLuiJQDA.text: Great place for lunch. A delicious crab Rangoon with every dish, and prices for lunch are very good. I've gotten several dishes there and don't think you can go wrong. Spice levels are inconsistent (I.e a 4 one day is not always the same as a 4 the next) but that's how a lot of places are so what's new. Highly recommend.

bPD4chGqcAi3FW0OkudsZg.text: I've been there several times for lunch and it is almost always good; however, I ordered takeout for dinner since I was downtown and my drunken noodles aka pad kee mao was tasteless. Kee mao is supposed to be a little bit spicy even if you order a lower level spice but this was almost inedible. Also, they did not give us any utensils or napkins for takeout or even offer them. We were staying at a hotel downtown so they were actually necessary. I'm leaving it at 3 stars since it's usually good at lunch but definitely a disappointing dinner experience. I'll stick to my usual thai places for dinner: Smiling Banana Leaf, Thai Cuisine, and NoodleHead from now on!

NPMf5n_Nia6WSOjLr2raHw.text: Quick service and welcoming. I had the spicy Thai rice with chicken. Really good. Apparently my review can be 2 sentences long so I had to right this sentence as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Spicy Fried Rice w/ Chicken

PwLAWeizNVFfweyzNmtXVQ.text: Travel by PIT heard so much abt this thai restaurant, when I get there so disappointed. WHY? Because they are not open. Yap show is open , Google show is not until 4pm, fine I can wait.. When I get there see the new business hr , n guess what, after standing on the street waiting n call the phone.. NO ONE answer or no sign of life form! If u can not honor this basic principles, how good ur food can that be ? Can u even keep ur standard?

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New business hr.. But No one there..

8a35C4lEwlONdAGSlFPSoA.text: While in the mood for something other than an elephant scab on a bun for lunch today, I walked into Siam Thai to see what they were like. The place was nearly empty when I walked in with the exception of one couple already seated. Granted, we had a ton of snow dumped on us this morning so I didn't take the lack of business as a sign that there was anything wrong with the place. I was greeted cheerfully when I walked in and was seated immediately. Within a minute I had a menu, a glass of water and a single ragoon on a plate with sauce.  Looking over the menu I decided on the Stir Fried Broccoli.  With each meal you get your choice of chicken, pork, tofu, beef, duck or shrimp. I originally was going to go with the duck but since they were out of that on this particular day I went with the beef.  I was also asked to what degree of spiciness I would like and I went with an 8 on a 1 to 10 scale.   The meal was in front of me within five minutes. The rice came molded into a heart-shape which I thought was a nice touch. The broccoli and carrots were good and crunchy (not soft and overcooked), the brown sauce had a very good kick to it but sadly the meat was awful! It was all tough and gristly making me wish that they had the duck available or that I would have chosen chicken instead.     My bill came to a little over $10. The service was fast and friendly, the atmosphere was comfortable and this place has a lot going for it... but it's not even close to being the quality of Nicky's Thai Kitchen on Penn. I give it a 3 star mainly due to the meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic chicken
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kYFto43rhPeQBUFaGeX7lQ.text: I ordered lunch from here recently via GrubHub, and it was much better than the last place I tried. I got chicken Pad Thai and a coke, and it took less than half an hour for my food to arrive. The Pad Thai had a delicious reddish sauce that wasn't too sweet, and the chicken and vegetables were all up to par. The spice level actually had a kick to it as well, so keep that in mind when ordering. Given the very generous portion size (particularly for such a cheap lunch price) I know I'll be keeping Siam Thai Restaurant in mind for future GrubHub orders.

Bc8cjyGosiGD79HOX1Lhsw.text: True hole in the wall establishment with authentic Thai flavors.  They know how to add spiciness to the cashew chicken which is very flavorful.  Very quick with lunch orders to go, pretty much ready in 10-15 minutes at peak time for a single order.

sCRpJPnAHqXgOEltbJq0zQ.text: Siam was a sold 3.5. The first thing that I noticed was the frigidness of the dinning room.  It was uncomfortably chilly and the two space heaters that were running did nothing to heat the space up.  I ate my meal with my scarf on and would have worn my hat too but I thought it might look a little low brow. The service was friendly but a little too quick when it came to placing my order. I was given almost no time to review the menu. I had hardly had my coat off before the waitress was back asking me if I already knew what I wanted to eat.  This being my first visit and all I did not appreciate that much, but I am sure in future visits it would be a nice touch once I familiarize myself with the menu.   I had the steamed pork dumplings and the Garlic pepper with mixed seafood. The dumplings were rubbery and under seasoned and  after eating them I wished I had never ordered them.  The garlic pepper sauce on my entree is what has me awarding 3 stars to Siam it was very flavorful.  But the mixed seafood looked like a horror show with three tiny sad looking shrimp and a cold scallop. For $10.50 I was fed a quarter cup of food and had to eat all of my rice to fill me up.  I am in no rush to get back Siam. And the server kept trying to hand my dishes to the man setting next to me.  The dining room was not busy at all for them to have gotten my order mixed up. It's cold and flu season I really don't want some stranger pawing my food unnecessarily.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. complementary tea and crab rangoon
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic pepper with mixed seafood

AHUEN7j35pIubZg60cPc5Q.text: Good place to eat, hole in the wall but always busy. I've eaten here a dozen times or so with friends and my wife, who both liked the food. Consistency is spotty. You either get a home run great food or an oh well maybe next time meal. If in the downtown area is worth a visit.

IiJEU6PAPXsORKORX7hKeg.text: I stopped here after the restaurant I wanted to go to mysteriously closed. Their food is very yummy. The staff is pleasant and I will definitely be back. I looked into my bag and smiled that I got a free treat added into my bag. I never knew this place was there and it's definitely a gem.

g1OcSNR_KmSKy6fn3sxMew.text: Great Thai food.  Some of the best in Pittsburgh.  The restaurant is definitely run down and the bathrooms aren't a heated but the food is great!

WxjDbaiNpN4B9mwPJgOSQA.text: Went here twice in the last few weeks and the food is very good. The first time I had the pineapple curry with chicken. The curry was slightly sweet with just the right amount of spicy heat. The second trip here I ordered basil chicken. It was tender juicy chicken with a nice brown sauce,green pepper, onion and fresh basil. Also very delicious!!  Anytime I'm in downtown Pittsburgh I'll be stopping here to try more Thai food.

WtDWyygHorV0wh02Oo46FA.text: Good food.  Pad Thai was spot on.  Don't know why they serve a single, cold crab Rangoon with lunch.  Gross.  Service was horrible.  They ignored me when I walked in for pick up, and worse...  My biggest pet peeve..   for a total of $10.13, I paid $11 and she asked if I wanted change.  For takeout!!!    Maybe it's a cultural difference, but I won't be back.  Stick to Angkor in Greentree.

3fnPjzb63970bA0n6rIuJA.text: Absolutely one of the best lunch options downtown. Inexpensive, friendly staff, and the food is on par with (if not better than) Pittsburgh's more well-known Thai offerings.

lwajylhdtWaa0lkTjNUIgA.text: Pad Thai was delicious! Service was good, despite it being a very busy lunch rush.  I gave four stars because our spring rolls were cold on the inside and the Thai iced tea was sweeter than normal. Otherwise everything was great and I will be back.

laNidYzmfI9vxgJxzW2YvQ.text: Today I wanted something different for lunch, so I ordered take out from Siam. I ate lunch in a couple times but many years ago and always had good service (I ordered pineapple fried rice back then, delish) I know they closed and reopened so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. I ordered pineapple curry with chicken, level 6. It was waiting for me after 20 minutes. I will say, the dining room was packed and very loud, I could barely hear the cashier tell me my total. My lunch was $9.10 plus tip and it is amazing! The crab Rangoon was a nice surprise and totally delicious, the curry is even better! I will definitely be back to try the fried rice again!

jzTLY7Wvq4L8NMB3nrTakA.text: I had heard great things about Siam's and finally got around to giving it try.  I wanted something quick and easy so I ordered the Thai fried rice to go. It came out in less than ten minutes and was delicious. The portion was huge and easily shareable with one or even two other people. I loved that they threw in a free crab ragoon. It also was very tasty!  The menu seemed reasonably priced and the staff were super friendly.  I can't wait to go back and try more of their food!

hUsTTVeFr8hyypEDIf43BA.text: Man, this place defines what I think of when I talk about Mom and Pop establishments.  These places don't have large dining rooms or fancy decor but their food is as good as, if not better, than the big name places.  My lunch crew frequents another Thai place that will not be named here, because that isn't fair.  A few days ago one of the guys, who loves spice, was going on about a little place that was more affordable but just as good.  Yesterday I decided to give that place a shot, and I was not disappointed.  From the moment that I walked in the door I felt as though Siam had the potential to be the type of small business that I love.  It is the kind of place that you'd completely miss unless, and potentially pass by, unless someone points it out.  When I walk into one of these smaller establishments I pay attention to three things.  1. How does it smell?  If it smells weird, I'm out.  I made the mistake of ignoring this rule once and regretted it.  Siam smelled like yummy food, as it should.  2. Are there plenty of customers?  We were early for lunch,but the place was already half filled.  That is a good sign.  3. Was there a friendly greeter.  There was!  Boom!  Magic was about to happen, I could feel it.  Once we were seated I took a quick look at the menu to see if there was anything interesting other than my default choice.  I didn't see anything out of the ordinary.  Being that this was my first visit we decided to get some appetizers.  We ordered Thai Spring Rolls and Samosas.    The spring rolls were fried to perfection.  Not too oily, and filled with flavor.  The home-made sweet and sour sauce that came with them was an excellent addition.  It was a light color like butter... sooo good.  There were too many people around for me to lick the bowl... plus we were sharing and licking the bowl is against bro code when sharing.  I personally love Samosas.  They are missing from the menu at other place that we frequent.  Siam's Samosas were so good that they may cause me to make Siam a regular spot over the other place.  Like the spring rolls they were fried to perfection.  The filling was perfect.  The texture was soft and they were seasoned just right.  Not too much, or too little.  They were served with a cucumber sauce, according to the menu.  It looked a lot like the sweet and sour sauce with peanuts on it.  Either way, it was delicious.  I may need a to-go order over the weekend.  I forgot to mention, we were also given a free Crab Rangoon, bonus!  The big thing with Thai places is the ability to pick your spice level.  Siam has a range of 1 to 10, which is double the range that some other local places have.  For some reason, I like the larger range... but this could be purely psychological.    When going to a new place for the first time I tend to stick with a dish that I know I like.  If they do well with that then I'll come back and branch out.  When it comes to Thai, I love Pad Thai.  So I ordered it at a spice level 6.  My friend ordered the same dish at a level 10!  Level 6 had plenty of spice, in fact I'd consider going back to a 5 next time.  I'm not sure how my buddy was able to handle a 10.  Thankfully they kept the water flowing.  In spite of the spice, it was darn good.  I couldn't stop eating.  The noodles were perfectly cooked, the sauce tasted great, the portion of peanuts was perfect, and the chicken was good too!  My only regret was not trying the Thai Iced Tea... Next time Siam.... Next time... and believe me.  There WILL be a next time.

YBFuf9QX0lxdTB7SMG6HvA.text: This was a great spot for my lunch break! It's kind of hard to find, but once you find it, you're in for a treat! I got the Spicy Thai Fried Rice with chicken! I got spice level 5/10 which honestly did it for me. If recommend a 3 if you like spice as a flavor, and not as an adrenaline kicker! I also got their Thai tea to help me wash down the spice. Their Thai tea was absolutely delicious!   I really loved that they give you a complimentary crab Rangoon for appetizers. It came with a oil based sauce which was super delicious.   Great place for Thai food, good service, and great Thai tea!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1. Thai Iced Tea
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Thai fried rice

OjVkSGuM2rVfxdNTKgE2iA.text: Hidden germs authentic Thai restaurant. I had the Spicy Basil ground chicken was so good, good price too! Definitely will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Basil ground chicken

cZZ70F6rU5Mir2ze7GhKqQ.text: In Pittsburgh for the work day & this place was recommended by colleagues. Small, cosy eatery that's tucked away in one of downtown Pitt's side streets so it's easy to miss if you don't know where you're going.   Not as busy as you'd expect during the lunch hour and we were seated immediately. I ordered the spicy fried rice with beef. I'm a spicy eater so ordered it level 10. I've noticed a lot of Thai restaurants don't deliver on the spice level but not this spot! I was definitely glowing by the end of lunch!   The combination of spices was excellent & the meat was fresh & tender. The rice also, was well made & not clumpy. All important factors for me that show that each element of the dish is freshly prepared. They also served a crab Rangoon as a complimentary appetizer; a nice touch & delicious to boot.   All in all, if you're in downtown Pitt & have a hankering for Thai...you could do a lot worse!

lBIE9jrvgC54e2uDMkqjSw.text: This is another one of those tucked away places downtown and that's ok with me. Like my own little secret. It's super close to my office and I love it! I go back and forth between this place and a couple of others within a few blocks of my office. Siam Thai is definitely one of my favorites. The spring rolls are so freaking good! I have had some really good ones in the past but nothing beats the ones you can get here. The Thai Spicy Fried Rice and Green Curry are to die for I tell you. Wow! Talk about dishes that pack a punch. These for sure hit the spot! I like my Thai spicy and this is how it should be done. They know what they're doing. The restaurant is kind of small and during lunch hour it is always busy and packed. I call ahead and my order is always ready, waiting and warm when I arrive. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. You really need to check it out on your own.

ocM0DcPQNuGyvu9sIyibCg.text: I ordered through the Grubhub app, & what a total fail in every possible category.  Delivery was only supposed to take 35-45 minutes, it took almost 2 hours.  Food was cold & drinks were warm.  I ordered their 3 most popular dishes, Shrimp Pad Thai, Spring Rolls, & Crab Rangoon.  Admittedly, nothing is very good after sitting for 2 hours, but it couldn't have been good fresh either.  The spring rolls are the generic frozen kind you can buy at your grocery store.  Disgusting.  The crab rangoon actually had a light fishy flavor, ODD.  The pad thai was reddish in color, also ODD, dry, and pretty bland.  Portion/Bang for your Buck=POOR.  Huge bowl of dry noodles with 4 shrimp for $13.  4 tiny spring rolls for $6, 4 crab rangoon for $6.  Delivery fee of $3 to wait 2 hours, PLUS A TIP, before you find out it will take 2 hours.  Horrible experience all the way 'round, just go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Pad Thai
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nothing homemade about these.  Nasty little frozen grocery store spring rolls
Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A1. Thai Spring Roll

ndErG-EC6ltkBarRGRcVGA.text: Looking for a solid lunch place to go in the city? Maybe you are in the mood for Thai food? Whatever the case may be, Siam Thai restaurant is a tasty, affordable choice. Recently, working in this part of downtown on Blvd of Allies, there a ton of lunch spots to choose from. It's my goal to get more familiar with this side of town and find all the hidden gems that there may be. I can largely thank my coworkers for that because no one ever packs lunches any more. Besides me of course.   First time walking in and it's a small place. The dining room is tiny and the tables are pretty close to one another. Being that it was 12pm noon and lunch time, there wasn't an empty seat in the place. But that is when the quick service takes over. I went with a party of 8 including myself and are orders were placed and food was brought out to us in about 20 minutes.   Besides the quick service, the food was delicious! I got the Cashew Nut chicken with white rice. I'm a baby when it comes to spicy, so I got a 0. I know, no need to rub it in. But my dish was perfect and I really enjoyed the crunch of the cashews. All for $9 and you can't beat that for lunch! A cute little touch was my rice being shaped into a heart! I feel the love Siam Thai, I feel the love!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cashew nut chicken!

vmFp-GiKMzIlbcTlJde_FA.text: The food is great, but getting here can be a challenge.  In my case, I was driving from the Uniontown area, and following GPS directions. If you are not from this region, attend to which lane you are told to be in, especially on bridges! Even then, be careful; I was directed to make a left turn at an intersection which had NO TURNS signs posted, and had to loop around in order to get to a nearby parking ramp.  This is a small place, and might be easy to overlook, but it was busy when we were there, late in the lunch hour, with more people coming in after us. The decoration may not be attractive, and the plates and glasses might look like they were acquired at a thrift store, but they are all clean...and you are going to get wonderful food.  We ordered Thai iced tea, which was just the right flavor; I've been to a number of Thai restaurants across the USA, and the drink (and food!) were consistent with the best of them. We also got a complimentary cream-cheese wonton, with a little dipping sauce.  We had ordered a samosa appetizer, which was crispy outside and steamy inside. This was a great way to start the meal: Something tasty, but it didn't fill you up.  I ordered the Siam Tofu, steamed vegetables and crispy tofu with a Thai peanut sauce. There was a small amount of pooled water on the plate from the vegetables, which thinned the sauce a bit, but it was still flavorful. The tofu was served in long-but-wide planks, so I found a bite-size was achieved by cutting those in two. The side of rice came molded into a heart shape, which was very appealing, visually.  My companion ordered the Pad Kee Mao, drunken noodles with tofu, and enjoyed it very much. It is one of her favorite dishes at Thai places, and she kept the leftovers from hers to eat later.  One point on ordering: Spiciness. They have a ten-point scale, from 1 being no spice, to 10 being very spicy. The waiter told us that 3 is a good medium spice point to start with, and I agree. There was enough to notice and feel it, but it wasn't overwhelming.  We had leftovers which we took with, and enjoyed later on our trip. The menu made me wish it was close enough for us to visit again!

urtsvRS6W2g9zzHaudLm_g.text: Once again, another Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh doesn't disappoint.  Came here before a soccer game at Heinz field and we were the only ones.  The place itself is a bit hot but the food was def worth the slight inconvenience.  We ended up ordering pad thai, pad kee mow, and pad see ew.  We got varying spices from 3-8.  All the dishes came out quickly and were amazing.  One thing I will say is that I like the way they spice the dishes here.  I usually get a 10 at other places but a 7 was good enough for me here. This place is worth a stop if you're ever downtown.

uuu5U6PTHe29vdr9dDPmEQ.text: You ever go to a restaurant and they give you a spice scale and you think, damn I love spicy food so you order an 8 or 9? And usually it's kind of hot but overly covered in pepper flakes?  This is not that place.  You order an 8 you're getting an actual 8. It is HOT. They don't mess around with spice here. They are stone cold serious about spice, and I absolutely love it.  Their pad thai is delicous, the spring rolls are awesome and plentiful, and the crab angels are divine.  I feel like before I knew this place existed I settled for sub par Thai Food with lack luster seasoning and spice levels.   I am forever changed. My mind has been made up. My heart has been filled.  The staff is friendly, and for lunch they throw in a free crab angel and sauce! What is not to love about all of that. Their price points are reasonable and their portion sizes are filling and pleasing. They're located in a strange little spot behind the old AIP building downtown on first avenue. Seek them out. Your belly will thank you.

tBUP4kWt4J8DMzNdr-EMkQ.text: The pad thai with tofu is perfection. Spicy level 6 is ideal for me and I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The pad thai with tofu is the most amazing thing spicy level 6 is what I picked and it is PERFECT! Will definitely be back for more goodies!

fTzl7IDxww-Z79NpW1DPzQ.text: I am absolutely in love with this restaurant!  The god is always wonderful, the staff is kind and effective at their job and always makes sure lunch is made fast and so it fits into your break.     Their sticky rice is especially delicious because they put coconut milk in it to make it sweet!!  Check this place out, it is the best Thai in the area.

w6FWUAqSHIfxQEIwYV72vA.text: This place is very good and cheap. Today I got the spicy tail rice as a #7 and wow was that hot.   Food is reasonable at 8.50 and water is free. The people are very nice and welcoming. Normally it gets packed and has a small area for eating. Arrive early or after 1 and it will die down a little.

ss2o54hENebCONzYCOk3pw.text: Since opening, this place has perfect nearly every dish. Be careful when ordering spicy though, they tend to lay it on heavy.

izL28wWA5FOodO1BpsOSTQ.text: I went here for lunch while I was at work. I ordered the Pad Kee Mow. The food came out very quick (however I was brought Pad Thai). I let the server know and he just took it back and brought me a new dish about 5 minutes later. I'm pretty sure I was given Pad See Ew because of how it tasted. I didn't say anything and just ate it. The food was great and service was quick but could've been better if I was given the right food.

QoA6jMzEAYhLQtSGXI84nw.text: The chief's mood and the service is very unsteady I think.  1) the spicy level- sometimes level 2 is two spicy, and sometimes level 6 is not spicy at all. But you can always play safe to order a low level of spiciness and ask for a side of pepper flakes  2) the amount - sometimes they make a small portion, sometimes I feel like they put two orders into one plate, today's was super big! Which is good but I got too full. Haha 3) speed - it can be fast within 5 minutes or it can be quite a wait like 20,30minutes. Maybe you colleges or friends are finishing their meal while yours just got out of kitchen.   So it really depends! But the taste is always good! Haven't been disappointed even once,  Pak kee mow is my favorite!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad kee maw

ALBNcQjlER6dvB1KSqXi5A.text: I got chicken Pad Thai and asked for it mildly spicy. I should have asked for medium spice because it came out pink and tasted sweet. The Thai iced tea was good though!

pemfMuti7ynQz1ZfzR5v6w.text: I decided to give this place a second chance ..... the food was good but the service was awful The server was extremely rude even while the owner was there ...I will never go back,Nicky'sThai Kitchen will be my choice

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Thai Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Disgusting

TnI96gR-8-R8D9pU6n38tQ.text: Have been a patron for almost five years and have gotten many of my friends to make this their go to spot for quick Thai food. Consistently good with plenty of heat in their dishes (for those that want it). Always friendly and great for a quick lunch stop.
